metadata.Title: CVE-2018-18439 on Ubuntu 23.10 (mantic) - negligible.
metadata.Description:
DENX U-Boot through 2018.09-rc1 has a remotely exploitable buffer overflow via a malicious TFTP server because TFTP traffic is mishandled. Also, local exploitation can occur via a crafted kernel image.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-18439` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

u-boot-amlogic - 2020.04+dfsg-2ubuntu1
u-boot-exynos - 2020.04+dfsg-2ubuntu1
u-boot-imx - 2020.04+dfsg-2ubuntu1
u-boot-microchip - 2020.04+dfsg-2ubuntu1
u-boot-mvebu - 2020.04+dfsg-2ubuntu1
u-boot-omap - 2020.04+dfsg-2ubuntu1
u-boot-qcom - 2020.04+dfsg-2ubuntu1
u-boot-qemu - 2020.04+dfsg-2ubuntu1
u-boot-rockchip - 2020.04+dfsg-2ubuntu1
u-boot-rpi - 2020.04+dfsg-2ubuntu1
u-boot-sifive - 2020.04+dfsg-2ubuntu1
u-boot-stm32 - 2020.04+dfsg-2ubuntu1
u-boot-sunxi - 2020.04+dfsg-2ubuntu1
u-boot-tegra - 2020.04+dfsg-2ubuntu1
u-boot-tools - 2020.04+dfsg-2ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: u-boot package in mantic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2020.04+dfsg-2ubuntu1').
